What do you need help with?: What do you need help with?
The Extendify pattern library can be ope: The Extendify pattern library can be opened by clicking the button to the left.
Click on any pattern category to refine: Click on any pattern category to refine the selection.
Simply select any pattern you wish to in: Simply select any pattern you wish to insert into a page by clicking on it.
The selected pattern has been inserted i: The selected pattern has been inserted into the page.
Click the plus to open the block inserte: Click the plus to open the block inserter.
Add a block by clicking or dragging it o: Add a block by clicking or dragging it onto the page.
Edit the page title by clicking it. Note: Edit the page title by clicking it. Note: The title may or may not show up on the published page, depending on the page template used.
Each block will show up on the page and: Each block will show up on the page and can be edited by clicking on it.
This is a sample paragraph block. It can: This is a sample paragraph block. It can be several sentences long and will span multiple rows. You can add as many blocks as you'd like to the page.
Select either page or block to change th: Select either page or block to change the settings for the entire page or the block that is selected.
Click preview to view how your changes l: Click preview to view how your changes look on the front end of your site.
Click publish or update to save the chan: Click publish or update to save the changes you have made to the page and make them live on the site.
Click here to access the Add Plugins pag: Click here to access the Add Plugins page.
Search for a plugin by name or functiona: Search for a plugin by name or functionality.
See important information about each plu: See important information about each plugin.
Install the plugin. Then, press this but: Install the plugin. Then, press this button again to activate the plugin.
If you have a plugin from an external so: If you have a plugin from an external source, you can upload it directly here.
Click this menu to see and manage the pl: Click this menu to see and manage the plugins you have installed.
See all plugins installed on your site. This includes plugins that are active and deactivated.
Under each plugin you can activate or de: Under each plugin you can activate or deactivate it.
Click here to add another plugin to your: Click here to add another plugin to your site.
Now that you've created your starter sit: Now that you've created your starter site, make it your own with these follow up tasks.
Easily access some of the most common it: Easily access some of the most common items in WordPress with these quick links.
See our personalized recommendations for: See our personalised recommendations for you that will help you accomplish your goals.
You can always access the help center by: You can always access the help center by clicking this button.
You can always visit your site by clicki: You can always visit your site by clicking this button.
Come back to the Site Assistant any time: Come back to the Site Assistant any time by clicking the menu item.
Click here to view and manage the users: Click here to view and manage the users on your site.
See all of your users, including admin u: See all of your users, including admin users in this table.
Click the edit button to change the user: Click the edit button to change the user's role, manage their account, or change their profile information.
Use the search bar to find a particular: Use the search bar to find a particular user.
Click the Add New button to add a new us: Click the Add New button to add a new user to your site.
At any time, you can view your site (fro: At any time, you can view your site (from a visitor's perspective) from the top admin bar under your site's name.
Access the Site Assistant at any time.
Click here to go to your website managem: Click here to go to your website management dashboard. From there you will be able to create more websites, and manage your account settings.
The default WordPress dashboard will hav: The default WordPress dashboard will have some overall site metrics and modules added from certain plugins.
Add, edit, or remove images and other me: Add, edit, or remove images and other media from your library. When you upload an image to be used on your site, it will be added to the library.
Use the pages menu to add, delete, or ed: Use the pages menu to add, delete, or edit the pages on your site.
If you have commenting enabled on your p: If you have commenting enabled on your posts, you can manage those comments here.
Manage your theme and access the Site Ed: Manage your theme and access the Site Editor from the Appearance menu. The Site Editor is where you can make global changes to your site (such as the menu, header/footer, and styles).
Add or manage the plugins on your site.
Add or manage users on your site, both a: Add or manage users on your site, both admin users and others.
Import\/export post data, check site hea: Import/export post data, check site health, and edit theme or plugin files directly in the WordPress admin.
Advanced settings for your site and for: Advanced settings for your site and for certain plugins.
Use this toggle to collapse or expand th: Use this toggle to collapse or expand the sidebar menu.
Manage your profile or log out of your a: Manage your profile or log out of your account here.
